statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Fletcher Magee hit six 3-pointers and scored 27 points to lead Wofford to a 70-57 win over High Point on Sunday, it's fourth straight.
article.headline: Magee scores 27, Wofford defeats High Point 70-57
article.linkText: Magee scores 27, Wofford defeats High Point 70-57
article.story: ASHEVILLE, N.C. -- Fletcher Magee hit six 3-pointers and scored 27 points to lead Wofford to a 70-57 win over High Point on Sunday, it's fourth straight. Cameron Jackson added 15 points off the bench for the Terriers (7-4), and Derrick Brooks had nine rebounds help Wofford control the boards 35-22. After the Panthers (4-7) opened the scoring, Wofford scored 10 straight with Trevor Stumpe and Magee knocking downing 3-pointers. Four different players scored in an 8-0 that made it 23-9 with nine minutes to play in the first half. High Point cut the deficit to 34-26 at the break and an early five points cut it to 38-33 but the Terriers steadily pulled away. Andre Fox had 13 points and Brandonn Kamga 12 for High Point. Magee was just named the Southern Conference player of the week for the second time this season and fourth time in his career after scoring 36 points in an upset of Georgia Tech and 22 in 15 minutes of a rout of Johnson & Wales.
